creditline:
The William M. Ladd Collection
Gift of Herschel V. Jones, 1916
marks: Verso on the tab, in pencil: [168] LL recto, in pencil: sheet trimmed leaving a tab f
medium: Etching and drypoint with plate tone
text: Palaces, like apparitions, mysteriously float between the dark water and the night sky. The lantern on the bridge faintly glows. Whistler used etching and drypoint to suggest the structure of the palaces, but to capture the subtle splendor of Venice by night he left a veil of ink on his plate to produce the glassy surface of the water and duskiness of the sky.
title: Nocturne: Palaces from "The Second Venice Set"
